message.body: i stumbled upon zeronet the other day
so far feels like a ghost town
i guess the problem is the same as with the internet in its early days, people dont see what to do with it
i've never heard about freenet. what's the matter with it?
i think the ipfs's approach to the cp problem is the wisest one, you can block cp, but only if it's public. and you can't block it from other people, you can just be not seeding it
yea but the thing is that you can't really censor cp, you can only block it if the site's key is public
can someone explain what's the difference between ZN and ipfs? are they competing decentralisation attempts?
does someone know if it's possible to see a page's implementation? for instance a file sharing http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GrtBsG57kjU2Z3iAQebG9D5c8CRDRLoPj/files.html
to be sure it works properly, u kno
is there an easy way to clone a site if the context menu on zerohello doesnt contain a clone button?
